info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 8:08PM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Menard, northwestern Sangamon, Cass, south central Mason and northeastern Morgan Counties through 900 PM CDT... At 807 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms over mainly over Menard, northwestern Sangamon, Cass, south central Mason and northeastern Morgan Counties. Movement was southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Ashland and Pleasant Plains around 815 PM CDT. Petersburg around 820 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Greenview, Literberry, Jacksonville and Athens. This includes Interstate 72 between mile markers 69 and 78. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for central and west central Illinois.
